description: The article discusses regenerative design, focusing on permaculture and biomimicry as key techniques. It emphasizes learning from nature, collaboration over competition in ecosystems, and the importance of alignment in creating sustainable systems. The text highlights how decentralized ecosystems can be more resilient and vibrant than centralized organizations, empowering communities to create healthier environments.
excerpt: Regenerative design aims to improve environments sustainably. It employs techniques like permaculture and biomimicry, emphasizing collaboration with nature. Modern biology reveals ecosystems work towards optimal health for the whole, challenging classic Darwinian views of competition.
